edu.sjsu.cs.ghost151
Class ConsoleGameDriver

java.lang.Object
  edu.sjsu.cs.ghost151.ConsoleGameDriver

public class ConsoleGameDriver
extends java.lang.Object

ConsoleGameDriver is responsible for instantiating the Game instance and requesting the number of ghosts the user would like in the simulation.

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

Parameters:
args - public static void main(String[] args) { Game game = Game.INSTANCE; int numberOfGhosts = 4; try { numberOfGhosts = Integer.valueOf(args[1]); } catch (Exception e) { } Board board = game.getBoard(); int maximumGhosts = board.ROWS * board.COLUMNS - 2 * board.ROWS - 2 (board.COLUMNS - 2) - 1; The first argument is optional and can be an integer representing the number of ghosts to place on the board. The maximum number of ghosts is the number of empty spaces on the Board minus 1 (for the target). For the standard board configuration (10x20), that is 143.
